text: <@U02RT4NUGPK> the sticking point for a lot of content peeps seems to be that an AI tool can't gauge what your audience or ICP actually cares about or needs, so while they can help from an SEO point, like <@U01A827PTTM> mentioned, it needs solid copy to begin with, and that stems from knowing who you're ultimately selling to or trying to attract. Personally, I think they should be taken with a grain of salt, but I've seen some content marketers use them for headline/article title help more than anything.

elements.text: the sticking point for a lot of content peeps seems to be that an AI tool can't gauge what your audience or ICP actually cares about or needs, so while they can help from an SEO point, like

mentioned, it needs solid copy to begin with, and that stems from knowing who you're ultimately selling to or trying to attract. Personally, I think they should be taken with a grain of salt, but I've seen some content marketers use them for headline/article title help more than anything.

text: <@U02MGP08MNH> yeah I totally agree. Short form content seems to be useful to get the wheels spinning and anything long form text tends to turn the writer into an editor. Still can be useful to potentially expand into other creative lines of thought, but it certainly requires a human touch to address the specific needs of an audience.

elements.text: yeah I totally agree. Short form content seems to be useful to get the wheels spinning and anything long form text tends to turn the writer into an editor. Still can be useful to potentially expand into other creative lines of thought, but it certainly requires a human touch to address the specific needs of an audience.
